author: Scott Adam Gordon
title: Google Photos ‘Albums’ view gets tweaked to show more stuff
text:
The latest Google Photos app update — version 2.8 — introduces some changes to the albums view to include more pictures. The albums tab is now divided into three sections: exploration, photos on device, and user-created albums.
The exploration row previously seen in albums contains collections of photos like People, Places, Things etc. — it’s the collections generated by Google’s algorithms to help you find specific types of pictures. This row is now larger and holds more thumbnails — four instead of three — so you know more about the content inside.
The Photos on Device row used to be called Device Folders and contains pictures taken with your camera app, your screenshots, as well as media from other apps like WhatsApp or Twitter.
See also: Instagram testing multiple photos in one post with some Android users 1 day ago The third row is for the albums you’ve created. Unlike the full-width photos provided before, however, these are now also shown as square tiles like the other content.
Overall, there’s more information to seen on the album page now, but I’m not yet sure if it’s more intuitive. Check it out for yourself, download Google Photos via the Play Store link below.
